label: Earth material
definition: Geologic map unit classification (Bruce R. Johnson) version 6.2: A hierarchical classification of earth materials for digital geologic maps.

children.label: Metamorphic rock
children.definition: A rock derived from pre-existing rocks by mineralogical, chemical, and/or structural changes, essentially in the solid state, in response to marked changes in temperature, pressure, shearing stress, and chemical environment, generally at depth in the earth's crust.

children.label: Amphibolite
children.definition: A crystalloblastic rock consisting mainly of amphibole and plagioclase with little or no quartz.

children.label: Calc-silicate rock
children.definition: A metamorphic rock consisting mainly of calcium-bearing silicates such as diopside and wollastonite, and formed by metamorphism of impure limestone or dolomite.

children.label: Eclogite
children.definition: A granular rock composed essentially of garnet (almandine-pyrope) and sodic pyroxene (omphacite).

children.label: Gneiss
children.definition: A foliated rock formed by regional metamorphism, in which bands or lenticles of granular minerals alternate with bands or lenticles in which minerals having flaky or elongate prismatic habits predominate. Generally less than 50% of the minerals show preferred orientation.

children.label: Felsic gneiss
children.definition: A gneissic rock dominated by light-colored minerals, commonly quartz and feldspar

children.label: Granitic gneiss
children.definition: A gneissic rock with a general granitoid composition

children.label: Biotite gneiss
children.definition: A granitic gneiss in which the dominant mafic mineral is biotite

children.label: Mafic gneiss
children.definition: A gneissic rock dominated by dark-colored minerals, commonly biotite and hornblende

children.label: Migmatite
children.definition: A composite "mixed rock" composed of igneous or igneous-appearing and metamorphic portions

children.label: Orthogneiss
children.definition: A gneissic rock formed from an igneous parent

children.label: Paragneiss
children.definition: A gneissic rock formed from a sedimentary parent

children.label: Granofels
children.definition: A medium- to coarse-grained granoblastic metamorphic rock with little or no foliation or lineation.

children.label: Granulite
children.definition: A metamorphic rock consisting of even-sized, interlocking mineral grains less than 10% of which have any obvious preferred orientation.

children.label: Greisen
children.definition: A pneumatolytically altered granitic rock composed largely of quartz, mica, and topaz.

children.label: Hornfels
children.definition: A fine-grained rock composed of a mosaic of equidimensional grains without preferred orientation and typically formed by contact metamorphism.

children.label: Metasedimentary rock
children.definition: A sedimentary rock that shows evidence of having been subjected to metamorphism.

children.label: Marble
children.definition: A metamorphic rock consisting predominantly of fine- to coarse-grained recrystallized calcite and/or dolomite, usually with a granoblastic, saccharoidal texture.

children.label: Meta-argillite
children.definition: An argillite that has been metamorphosed.

children.label: Metaconglomerate
children.definition: A metamorphic rock formed by recrystallization of a conglomerate.

children.label: Quartzite
children.definition: A granoblastic metamorphic rock consisting mainly of quartz and formed by recrystallization of sandstone or chert by either regional or thermal metamorphism.

children.label: Slate
children.definition: A compact, fine-grained metamorphic rock that possesses slaty cleavage and hence can be split into slabs and thin plates

children.label: Metavolcanic rock
children.definition: A volcanic rock that shows evidence of having been subjected to metamorphism.

children.label: Felsic metavolcanic rock
children.definition: A metavolcanic rock having abundant light-colored minerals, typically quartz and feldspar

children.label: Keratophyre
children.definition: ...all salic extrusive and hypabyssal rocks characterized by the presence of albite or albite-oligoclase and chlorite, epidote, and calcite, generally of secondary order.

children.label: Metarhyolite
children.definition: A low-grade, felsic metavolcanic rock with preserved evidence of its original rhyolitic character

children.label: Intermediate metavolcanic rock
children.definition: A metavolcanic rock having approximately equal light- and dark-colored minerals in its mode

children.label: Mafic metavolcanic rock
children.definition: A metavolcanic rock having abundant dark-colored minerals, typically feldspar, amphibole, and/or pyroxene

children.label: Greenstone
children.definition: A field term applied to any compact, dark-green, altered or metamorphosed basic igneous rock (e.g. spilite, basalt, gabbro, diabase) that owes its color to the presence of chlorite, actinolite, or epidote.

children.label: Metabasalt
children.definition: A low-grade, mafic metavolcanic rock with preserved evidence of its original basaltic character

children.label: Spilite
children.definition: An altered basalt, characteristically amygdaloidal or vesicular, in which the feldspar has been albitized and is typically accompanied by chlorite, calcite, epidote, chalcedony, prehnite, or other low-temperature hydrous crystallization products characteristic of a greenstone.

children.label: Phyllite
children.definition: A metamorphosed rock, intermediate in grade between slate and mica schist. Minute crystals of graphite, sericite, or chlorite impart a silky sheen to the surfaces of cleavage (or schistosity).

children.label: Schist
children.definition: A strongly foliated crystalline rock, formed by dynamic metamorphism, that can be readily split into thin flakes or slabs due to the well developed parallelism of more than 50% of the minerals present, particularly those of the lamellar or elongate prismatic habit, e.g. mica and hornblende.

children.label: Amphibole schist
children.definition: A schist whose essential constituent is amphibole with lesser amounts of feldspar, quartz, and/or mica

children.label: Blueschist
children.definition: A schistose metamorphic rock with a blue color owing to the presence of sodic amphibole, glaucophane, or crossite, and commonly mottled bluish-gray lawsonite; characteristic of metamorphism in areas of unusually low thermal gradient, such as subduction zones

children.label: Calc-silicate schist
children.definition: A metamorphosed calcareous rock, commonly derived from argillaceous limestone or calcareous mudstone, containing calcium-bearing silicates such as diopside and wollastonite, with a schistose structure produced by parallelism of platy minerals

children.label: Greenschist
children.definition: A schistose metamorphic rock whose green color is due to the presence of chlorite, epidote, or actinolite; a common product of low-grade regional metamorphism of pelitic or basic igneous rocks

children.label: Mica schist
children.definition: A schist whose essential constituents are mica and quartz, and whose schistosity is mainly due to the parallel arrangement of mica flakes.

children.label: Pelitic schist
children.definition: A schistose metamorphic rock derived by metamorphism of an argillaceous or a fine-grained alluminous sediment.

children.label: Quartz-feldspar schist
children.definition: A schist whose essential constituents are quartz and feldspar and having lesser amounts of mica and/or hornblende

children.label: Serpentinite
children.definition: A rock consisting almost wholly of serpentine-group minerals derived from the hydration of ferromagnesian silicate minerals such as olivine and pyroxene.

children.label: Skarn
children.definition: A rock of complex mineralogic composition formed by contact metamorphism and metasomatism of carbonate rocks.  It is typically coarse-grained and rich in garnet, iron-rich pyroxene, epidote, wollastonite, and scapolite.

children.label: Plutonic rock
children.definition: A rock formed at considerable depth by crystallization of magma and/or by chemical alteration.  It is characteristically medium- to coarse-grained, of granitoid texture.

children.label: Alkalic intrusive rock
children.definition: A plutonic rock that contains more sodium and/or potassium than is required to form feldspar with the available silica.

children.label: Nepheline syenite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having F/(F+A+P) between 10 an 60%, and P/(P+A) < 50%; composed essentially of alkali feldspar and nepheline...

children.label: Aplite
children.definition: A light-colored igneous rock characterized by a fine-grained allotriomorphic-granular (i.e. aplitic) texture.

children.label: Gabbroid
children.definition: A plutonic rock with Q < 20% or F < 10%, P/(A+P) > 65%, and pl/(pl+px+ol) between 10 and 90%.

children.label: Anorthosite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 0 and 5, P/(A+P) greater than 90, and M less than 10.  A group of monomineralogic plutonic igneous rocks composed almost entirely of plagioclase feldspar...

children.label: Gabbro
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 0 and 5% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, P/(A+P) greater than 90% and plagioclase more calcic than An50

children.label: Norite
children.definition: A plutonic rock satisfying the definition of gabbro, in which pl/(pl+px+ol) is between 10 and 90% and opx/(opx+cpx) is greater than 95%.

children.label: Troctolite
children.definition: A plutonic rock satisfying the definition of gabbro, in which pl/(pl+px+ol) is between 10 and 90% and px/(pl+px+ol) is less than 5%.

children.label: Monzogabbro
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q < 5% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, and P/(A+P) between 65 and 90%, and plagioclase more calcic than An50

children.label: Quartz gabbro
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 5 and 20%, P/(A+P) > 90%, and plagioclase more calcic than An50

children.label: Quartz monzogabbro
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 5 and 20% and P/(A+P) between 65 and 90%, and plagioclase more calcic than An50

children.label: Granitoid
children.definition: A general term for all phaneritic igneous rocks dominated by quartz and feldspars.

children.label: Alkali-feldspar granite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 20 and 60% and P/(A+P) < 10%

children.label: Alkali-feldspar syenite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) < 20% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, and P/(P+A) < 10%...

children.label: Diorite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 0 and 5% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, P/(A+P) greater than 90% and plagioclase more sodic than An50

children.label: Diabase
children.definition: A plutonic rock whose main components are labradorite and pyroxene and which is characterized by ophitic texture.

children.label: Granite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 20 and 60% and P/(A+P) between 10 and 65%

children.label: Metaluminous granite
children.definition: A granite with aluminum oxide > sodium oxide + potassium oxide, but with aluminum oxide < sodium oxide + potassium oxide + calcium oxide; typical accessories include: hornblende, epidote, melilite, or biotite + pyroxene

children.label: Peralkaline granite
children.definition: A granite with aluminum oxide < sodium oxide + potassium oxide; typical accessories include: soda pyroxene and soda amphibole

children.label: Peraluminous granite
children.definition: A granite with aluminum oxide > sodium oxide + potassium oxide + calcium oxide; typical accessories include: muscovite, biotite, corundum, topaz, garnet

children.label: Subaluminous granite
children.definition: A granite with aluminum oxide approximately equal to sodium oxide + potassium oxide; typical accessories include: olivine, orthopyroxene, clinopyroxene

children.label: Granodiorite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 20 and 60% and P/(A+P) between 65 and 90%

children.label: Monzodiorite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q < 5% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, and P/(A+P) between 65 and 90%, and plagioclase more sodic than An50

children.label: Monzonite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q < 5% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, and P/(A+P) between 35 and 65%

children.label: Quartz diorite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 5 and 20%, P/(A+P) > 90%, and plagioclase more sodic than An50

children.label: Quartz monzodiorite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 5 and 20% and P/(A+P) between 65 and 90%, and plagioclase more sodic than An50

children.label: Quartz monzonite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 5 and 20% and P/(A+P) between 35 and 65%

children.label: Quartz syenite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 5 and 20% and P/(A+P) between 10 and 35%

children.label: Syenite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q < 5% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, and P/(A+P) between 10 and 35%

children.label: Tonalite
children.definition: A plutonic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q between 20 and 60% and P/(A+P) > 90%

children.label: Trondhjemite
children.definition: A tonalite with color index (M) less than 15; composed essentially of sodic plagioclase, quartz, sparse biotite, and little or no alkali feldspar

children.label: Intrusive carbonatite
children.definition: A plutonic rock composed of at least 50% carbonate minerals.

children.label: Pegmatite
children.definition: An exceptionally coarse-grained igneous rock, with interlocking crystals, usually found as irregular dikes, lenses, or veins, esp. at the margins of batholiths.

children.label: Porphyry
children.definition: An igneous rock of any composition that contains conspicuous phenocrysts in a fine-grained groundmass.

children.label: Lamprophyre
children.definition: A group of porphyritic igneous rocks in which mafic minerals form the phenocrysts; feldspars, if present, are restricted to the groundmass.

children.label: Ultramafic intrusive rock
children.definition: A general name for plutonic rock with color index (M) greater than or equal to 90...

children.label: Hornblendite
children.definition: A plutonic rock with M equal to or greater than 90 and hbl/(hbl+px+ol) greater than 90%.

children.label: Peridotite
children.definition: A plutonic rock with M equal to or greater than 90 and ol/(ol+opx+cpx) greater than 40%

children.label: Dunite
children.definition: A plutonic rock with M equal to or greater than 90 and ol/(ol+opx+cpx) greater than 90%

children.label: Kimberlite
children.definition: A porphyritic alkalic peridotite containing abundant phenocrysts of olivine and phlogopite, and possibly geikielite and chromian pyrope, in a fine-grained groundmass of calcite and second-generation olivine and phlogopite...

children.label: Pyroxenite
children.definition: A plutonic rock with M equal to or greater than 90 and ol/(ol+opx+cpx) less than 40%.

children.label: Sedimentary rock
children.definition: A rock resulting from the consolidation of loose sediment that has accumulated in layers...

children.label: Carbonate rock
children.definition: A sedimentary rock composed of more than 50% by weight carbonate minerals.

children.label: Dolostone
children.definition: A carbonate sedimentary rock of which more than 50% by weight or by areal percentages under the microscope consists of the mineral dolomite.

children.label: Limestone
children.definition: A sedimentary rock consisting chiefly (more than 50% by weight or by areal percentages under the microscope) of calcium carbonate, primarily in the form of the mineral calcite...

children.label: Chemical sedimentary rock
children.definition: A sedimentary rock composed primarily of material formed directly by precipitation from solution or colloidal suspension or by the deposition of insoluble precipitates.

children.label: Chert
children.definition: A hard, extremely dense or compact, dull to semivitreous, microcrystalline or cryptocrystalline sedimentary rock, consisting dominantly of interlocking crystals of quartz less than 30 Âµm in diameter...

children.label: Evaporite
children.definition: A nonclastic sedimentary rock composed primarily of minerals produced from a saline solution as a result of extensive or total evaporation of the solvent.

children.label: Exhalite
children.definition: A chemical sedimentary rock, usually containing oxide, carbonate, or sulfide as anions, and iron, magnesium, base metals, and gold as cations, formed by the issuance of volcanically derived fluids onto the sea floor or into the sea.

children.label: Iron formation
children.definition: A chemical sedimentary rock, typically thin-bedded and/or finely laminated, containing at least 15% iron of sedimentary origin, and commonly but not necessarily containing layers of chert

children.label: Novaculite
children.definition: A dense, hard, even-textured, light-colored, cryptocrystalline siliceous sedimentary rock, similar to chert but characterized by dominance of microcrystalline quartz over chalcedony.

children.label: Clastic rock
children.definition: A composed principally of broken fragments that are derived from preexisting rocks or minerals and that have been transported some distance from their place of origin.

children.label: Coarse-grained mixed clastic rock
children.definition: A mixture of clastic sedimentary rocks varying from siltstone to conglomerate, dominated by rocks containing coarse sand-sized or gravel-sized particles.

children.label: Conglomerate
children.definition: A coarse-grained clastic sedimentary rock, composed of rounded to subangular fragments larger than 2 mm in diameter typically containing fine-grained particles in the interstices, and commonly cemented by calcium carbonate, iron oxide, silica, or hardened clay...

children.label: Fine-grained mixed clastic rock
children.definition: A mixture of clastic sedimentary rocks varying from mudstone to sandstone, dominated by rocks containing clay-sized or silt-sized particles

children.label: Medium-grained mixed clastic rock
children.definition: A mixture of clastic sedimentary rocks varying from siltstone to conglomerate, dominated by rocks containing sand-sized particles

children.label: Mudstone
children.definition: A general term that includes claystone, siltstone, shale, and argillite, and that should be used only when the amounts of clay-sized and silt-sized particles are not known or specified, or cannot be precisely identified...

children.label: Argillite
children.definition: A compact rock derived either from mudstone or shale, that has undergone a somewhat higher degree of induration than mudstone or shale but is less clearly laminated than shale and without its fissility, and that lacks the cleavage distinctive of slate.

children.label: Claystone
children.definition: An indurated rock having more than 67% clay-sized minerals.

children.label: Bentonite
children.definition: A soft, plastic, porous, light-colored rock composed essentially of clay minerals of the montmorillonite (smectite) group plus colloidal silica, and produced by devitrification and accompanying chemical alteration of a glassy igneous material, usually a tuff or volcanic ash.

children.label: Shale
children.definition: A laminated, indurated rock having more than 67% clay-sized minerals.

children.label: Black shale
children.definition: A dark, thinly laminated carbonaceous shale, exceptionally rich in organic matter (5% or more carbon content) and sulfide (esp. iron sulfide, usually pyrite), and often containing unusual concentrations of certain trace elements (U, V, Cu, Ni).

children.label: Oil shale
children.definition: A kerogen-bearing, finely laminated brown or black sedimentary rock that will yield liquid or gaseous hydrocarbon on distillation.

children.label: Siltstone
children.definition: An indurated silt having the texture and composition of shale but lacking its fine lamination or fissility; a massive mudstone in which silt-sized particles predominate over clay-sized particles.

children.label: Olistostrome
children.definition: A sedimentary deposit consisting of a chaotic mass of intimately mixed heterogeneous materials (such as blocks and muds) that accumulated as a semi-fluid body by submarine gravity sliding or slumping of unconsolidated sediments.

children.label: MÃ©lange
children.definition: A body of rock characterized by a lack of internal continuity of contacts or strata and by the inclusion of fragments and blocks of all sizes, both exotic and native, embedded in a fragmental matrix of finer-grained material.

children.label: Sandstone
children.definition: A medium-grained clastic sedimentary rock composed of abundant sand-sized fragments, which may have a finer-grained matrix (silt or clay), and which is more or less indurated by a cementing material...

children.label: Arenite
children.definition: A "clean" sandstone that is well-sorted, contains little or no matrix material, and has a relatively simple mineralogic composition; specif. a pure or nearly pure, chemically cemented sandstone containing less than 10% argillaceous matrix.

children.label: Calcarenite
children.definition: A clastic sedimentary rock that is made up predominantly of recycled carbonate particles of sand size; a consolidated calcareous sand

children.label: Orthoquartzite
children.definition: A clastic sedimentary rock that is made up almost exclusively of quartz sand (with or without chert), that is relatively free of or lacks a fine-grained matrix; a quartzite of sedimentary origin, or a "pure quartz sandstone".

children.label: Arkose
children.definition: A feldspar-rich sandstone, commonly coarse-grained and pink or reddish, that is typically composed of angular to subangular grains that may be either poorly or moderately well sorted... Quartz is usually the dominant mineral, with feldspars constituting at least 25%.

children.label: Wacke
children.definition: A "dirty" sandstone that consists of a mixed variety of unsorted or poorly sorted mineral and rock fragments and of an abundant matrix of clay and fine silt; specif. an impure sandstone containing more than 10% argillaceous matrix.

children.label: Graywacke
children.definition: ...a dark gray, firmly indurated, coarse-grained sandstone that consists of poorly sorted angular to subangular grains of quartz and feldspar, with a variety of dark rock and mineral fragments embedded in a compact clayey matrix having the general composition of slate and containing an abundance of very fine-grained illite, sericite, and chloritic minerals.

children.label: Sedimentary breccia
children.definition: A breccia (coarse-grained clastic rock composed of angular broken rock fragments held together by a mineral cement or a fine-grained matrix) formed by sedimentary processes

children.label: Coal
children.definition: A readily combustible rock containing more than 50% by weight and more than 70% by volume carbonaceous material, formed by compaction and induration of variously altered plant remains...

children.label: Mixed carbonate/clastic rock
children.definition: An undivided mixture of carbonate and clastic sedimentary rocks.

children.label: Mixed coal/clastic rock
children.definition: An undivided mixture of coal and clastic sedimentary rock.

children.label: Mixed volcanic/clastic rock
children.definition: An undivided mixture of volcanic rock and clastic sedimentary rock.

children.label: Phosphorite
children.definition: A sedimentary rock with a high enough content of phosphate minerals to be of economic interest.

children.label: Tectonite
children.definition: A rock whose fabric reflects the history of its deformation.

children.label: Augen gneiss
children.definition: Gneissic rock containing augen (large lenticular mineral grains or mineral aggregates having the shape of an eye in cross section)

children.label: Cataclasite
children.definition: A fine-grained, cohesive cataclastic rock, normally lacking a penetrative foliation or microfabric, formed during fault movement.

children.label: Flaser gneiss
children.definition: A dynamically metamorphosed rock in which lenses or layers of original or relatively unaltered granular materials are surrounded by a matrix of highly sheared and crushed material, giving the appearance of a crude flow structure

children.label: Mylonite
children.definition: A compact, chert-like rock without cleavage, but with a streaky or banded structure, produced by the extreme granulation and shearing of rocks that have been pulverized and rolled during overthrusting or intense dynamic metamorphism.

children.label: Phyllonite
children.definition: A rock that macroscopically resembles phyllite but that is formed by mechanical degradation (mylonitization) of initially coarser rocks...

children.label: Tectonic breccia
children.definition: A breccia formed as a result of crustal movements, usually developed from brittle rocks.

children.label: Tectonic mÃ©lange
children.definition: A mÃ©lange produced by tectonic processes.

children.label: Unconsolidated material
children.definition: A sediment that is loosely arranged or unstratified, or whose particles are not cemented together, found either at the surface or at depth.

children.label: Alluvium
children.definition: A general term for clay, silt, sand, gravel or similar unconsolidated detrital material, deposited during comparatively recent geologic time by a stream or other body of running water, as a sorted or semi-sorted sediment...

children.label: Alluvial fan
children.definition: A low, outspread, relatively flat to gently sloping mass of loose rock material, shaped like an open fan or a segment of a cone, deposited by a stream (esp. in a semiarid region) at the place where it issues from a narrow mountain valley upon a plain or broad valley...

children.label: Alluvial terrace
children.definition: A stream terrace composed of unconsolidated alluvium (including gravel), produced by renewed downcutting of the flood plain or valley floor...

children.label: Delta
children.definition: The low, nearly flat, alluvial tract of land at or near the mouth of a river, commonly forming a triangular or fan-shaped plain of considerable area...

children.label: Flood plain
children.definition: Unconsolidated sediment deposited adjacent to a river channel, constructed by the present river in its existing regimen and covered with water when the river overflows its banks.

children.label: Levee
children.definition: A long broad low ridge or embankment of sand and coarse silt, built by a stream on its flood plain and along both banks of its channel, esp. in time of flood when water overflowing the normal banks is forced to deposit the coarsest part of its load.

children.label: Biogenic material
children.definition: An organic material produced directly by the physiologic activities of organisms, either plant or animal

children.label: Coral
children.definition: A hard calcareous substance consisting of the continuous skeleton secreted by coral polyps for their support and habitation and found in single specimens growing plant-like on the sea bottom or in extensive, solidified accumulations (coral reefs).

children.label: Peat
children.definition: An unconsolidated deposit of semicarbonized plant remains in a water saturated environment, such as a bog or fen, and of persistently high moisture content (at least 75%).

children.label: Clay or mud
children.definition: A loose, earthy, extremely fine-grained, natural sediment composed primarily of clay-size or colloidal particles and characterized by high plasticity and by a considerable content of clay minerals...

children.label: Eolian material
children.definition: Sediments such as loess or sand deposited by the action of the wind

children.label: Dune sand
children.definition: A type of blown sand that has been piled up by the wind into a sand dune, usually consisting of rounded mineral grains, commonly quartz, having diameters ranging from 0.1 to 1 mm.

children.label: Loess
children.definition: A widespread, homogeneous, commonly nonstratified, porous, friable, slightly coherent, usually highly calcareous, fine-grained blanket deposit, consisting predominantly of silt with subordinate grain sizes ranging from clay to fine sand.

children.label: Sand sheet
children.definition: A large irregularly shaped plain of eolian sand, lacking the discernible slip faces that are common on dunes.

children.label: Glacial drift
children.definition: A general term applied to all rock material (clay, silt, sand, gravel, boulders) transported by a glacier and deposited directly by or from the ice, or by running water emanating from a glacier.

children.label: Stratified glacial sediment
children.definition: Stratified glacial drift deposited by, or reworked by running water, or deposited in standing water.

children.label: Glacial outwash sediment
children.definition: Stratified detritus (chiefly sand and gravel) removed or "washed out" from a glacier by meltwater streams and deposited in front of or behind the end moraine or the margin of an active glacier.

children.label: Glacial-marine sediment
children.definition: Deposits of glacially eroded, terrestrially derived sediment in the marine environment.

children.label: Glaciolacustrine sediment
children.definition: Deposits and landforms composed of suspended material brought by meltwater streams flowing into lakes bordering the glacier, such as deltas, kame deltas, and varved sediments.

children.label: Sub/supra-glacial sediment
children.definition: A variety of irregularly stratified sand and gravel deposits, such as eskers, kames, etc., that were deposited by a subglacial or supra-glacial stream or pond and were left behind when the ice melted

children.label: Till
children.definition: Dominantly unsorted and unstratified drift, generally unconsolidated, deposited directly by and underneath a glacier without subsequent reworking by meltwater...

children.label: Moraine
children.definition: A mound, ridge, or other distinct accumulation of unsorted, unstratified glacial drift, predominantly till, deposited chiefly by direct action of glacial ice...

children.label: Gravel
children.definition: A loose accumulation of rock fragments composed predominantly of more or less rounded pebbles and small stones

children.label: Lake or marine sediment
children.definition: A sedimentary deposit laid down conformably on the floor of, or along the shore of, a lake, sea, or ocean, usually consisting of coarse material near the shore and sometimes passing into clay and limestone in deeper water...

children.label: Beach sand
children.definition: A loose aggregate of unlithified mineral or rock particles of sand size forming a beach (the relatively thick and temporary accumulation of loose water-borne material that is in active transit along, or deposited on, the shore zone between the limits of low water and high water)

children.label: Mud flat
children.definition: A relatively level area of fine silt along a shore (as in a sheltered estuary) or around an island, alternately covered and uncovered by the tide, or covered by shallow water...

children.label: Playa
children.definition: ...a dry, vegetation-free, flat area at the lowest part of an undrained desert basin, underlain by stratified clay, silt, or sand, and commonly by soluble salts.

children.label: Terrace
children.definition: A narrow shelf, partly cut and partly built, produced along a lake shore...and later exposed when the water level falls, or ...a wave-cut platform that has been exposed by uplift along a seacoast or by the lowering of sea level, and from 3 m to more than 40 m above mean sea level; an elevated marine-cut bench.

children.label: Mass wasting material
children.definition: Deposits formed by the dislodgement and downslope transport of soil and rock material under the direct application of gravitational body stresses.

children.label: Colluvium
children.definition: A general term applied to any loose, heterogeneous, and incoherent mass of soil material and/or rock fragments deposited by rainwash, sheetwash, or slow, continuous downslope creep, usually collecting at the base of gentle slopes or hillsides.

children.label: Debris flow
children.definition: A moving mass of rock fragments, soil, and mud, more than half of the particles being larger than sand size.

children.label: Landslide
children.definition: A general term covering a wide variety of mass-movement landforms and processes involving the downslope transport, under gravitational influence, of soil and rock material, en mass.

children.label: Mudflow
children.definition: Deposits formed by a process characterized by a flowing mass of predominantly fine-grained earth material possessing a high degree of fluidity during movement.

children.label: Lahar
children.definition: A mudflow composed chiefly of volcaniclastic materials on the flank of a volcano.

children.label: Talus
children.definition: An outward sloping and accumulated heap or mass of rock fragments of any size or shape (usually coarse and angular) derived from and lying at the base of a cliff or very steep, rocky slope, and formed chiefly by gravitational falling, rolling, or sliding.

children.label: Residuum
children.definition: An accumulation or rock debris formed by weathering and remaining essentially in place after all but the least soluble constituents have been removed...

children.label: Sand
children.definition: A loose aggregate of unlithified mineral or rock particles of sand size (1/16 to 2 mm); an unconsolidated deposit consisting essentially of medium-grained clastic particles.

children.label: Silt
children.definition: A loose aggregate of unlithified mineral or rock particles of silt size (1/256 to 1/16 mm); an unconsolidated deposit consisting essentially of fine-grained clastic particles.

children.label: Volcanic ash
children.definition: A fine pyroclastic material (under 2.0 mm in diameter).  The term usually refers to the unconsolidated material...

children.label: Volcanic rock
children.definition: A generally finely crystalline or glassy igneous rock resulting from volcanic action at or near the Earth's surface, either ejected explosively or extruded as a lava.  The term includes near-surface intrusions that form a part of the volcanic structure.

children.label: Alkalic volcanic rock
children.definition: A volcanic rock that contains more sodium and/or potassium than is required to form feldspar with the available silica.

children.label: Phonolite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having F/(F+A+P) between 10 and 60%, and P/(P+A) < 10%...

children.label: Tephrite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having F/(F+A+P) between 10 and 60%, and P/(P+A) > 90%...

children.label: Felsic volcanic rock
children.definition: A light-colored, fine-grained or aphanitic extrusive or hypabyssal rock, with or without phenocrysts and composed chiefly of quartz and feldspar.

children.label: Alkali-feldspar rhyolite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) between 20 and 60% and P/(P+A) < 10%...

children.label: Alkali-feldspar trachyte
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) < 20% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, and P/(P+A) < 10%...

children.label: Dacite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) between 20 and 60% and P/(P+A) > 65%...

children.label: Latite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) < 5% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, and P/(P+A) between 35 and 65%...

children.label: Quartz latite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) between 5 and 20% and P/(P+A) between 35 and 65%...

children.label: Rhyodacite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) between 20 and 60% and P/(P+A) between 35 and 65%...

children.label: Rhyolite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) between 20 and 60% and P/(P+A) between 10 and 35%...

children.label: Trachyte
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined in the QAPF diagram as having Q/(Q+A+P) < 20% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, and P/(P+A) between 10 and 35%...

children.label: Glassy volcanic rock
children.definition: Extrusive rock having a texture which is similar to that of glass or quartz and developed as a result of rapid cooling of the lava without distinct crystallization.

children.label: Obsidian
children.definition: A black or dark-colored volcanic glass, usually of rhyolite composition, characterized by conchoidal fracture.

children.label: Pumice
children.definition: A light-colored vesicular glassy rock commonly having the composition of rhyolite.

children.label: Vitrophyre
children.definition: Any porphyritic igneous rock having a glassy groundmass.

children.label: Intermediate volcanic rock
children.definition: A solidified body of volcanic rock having approximately equal light- and dark-colored minerals in its mode

children.label: Andesite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined modally by Q/(Q+A+P) < 20% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, P/(A+P) > 90%, and M < 35

children.label: Trachyandesite
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined modally by Q/(Q+A+P) < 20% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, P/(A+P) between 65 and 90%, and M < 35

children.label: Lava flow
children.definition: A solidified body of rock that is formed by the lateral, surficial outpouring of molten lava from a vent or a fissure.

children.label: Bimodal suite
children.definition: A mixed sequence of sub-equal amounts of felsic and mafic volcanic rocks, commonly rhyolite and basalt with little or no intermediate composition rock.

children.label: Mafic volcanic rock
children.definition: A solidified body of volcanic rock having abundant dark-colored minerals in its mode

children.label: Basalt
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined modally by Q/(Q+A+P) < 20% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, P/(A+P) > 90%, and M > 35.

children.label: Alkaline basalt
children.definition: A basalt with nepheline and/or acmite in the CIPW norm.

children.label: Hawaiite
children.definition: A basalt in which the normative and modal feldspar is andesine, and with soda:potash ratio greater than 2:1.  It generally, but not always, lacks normative quartz, and commonly contains normative and modal olivine.

children.label: Tholeiite
children.definition: A silica-oversaturated basalt, characterized by the presence of low-calcium pyroxenes in addition to clinopyroxene and calcic plagioclase.  Olivine may be present in the mode, but neither olivine nor nepheline appear in the norm.

children.label: Trachybasalt
children.definition: A volcanic rock defined modally by Q/(Q+A+P) < 20% or F/(F+A+P) < 10%, P/(A+P) between 65 and 90%, and M > 35.

children.label: Pyroclastic rock
children.definition: ...clastic rock material formed by volcanic explosion or aerial expulsion from a volcanic vent.

children.label: Ignimbrite
children.definition: The deposit of a pyroclastic flow.

children.label: Tuff
children.definition: Consolidated or cemented volcanic ash.

children.label: Ash-flow tuff
children.definition: A tuff deposited by an ash flow or gaseous cloud; a type of ignimbrite.  It is a consolidated, but not necessarily welded deposit.

children.label: Welded tuff
children.definition: A glass-rich pyroclastic rock that has been indurated by the welding together of its glass shards under the combined action of the heat retained by particles, the weight of the overlying material, and hot gasses.

children.label: Volcanic breccia
children.definition: A pyroclastic rock that consists of angular volcanic fragments that are larger than 64 mm in diameter and that may or may not have a matrix.

children.label: Ultramafitite
children.definition: A volcanic rock with color index (M) greater than or equal to 90

children.label: Volcanic carbonatite
children.definition: A rock of apparent volcanic origin composed of at least 50% carbonate minerals
